rules.natural: If region1 has abundant rainfall, then region1 produces sufficient food.
Either region1 has abundant rainfall or region1 has an irrigation system.
Whenever region1 has an agricultural expert, region1 uses modern techniques.
Region1 has an agricultural expert or region1 follows best practices.
Provided that region1 monitors crop health, it follows that if region1 follows best practices, then whenever time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure.
In the event that region1 experiences drought, region1 has water surplus.
Either region1 experiences drought or time1 is the growing season.
Assuming region1 implements water rationing, region1 does not have water surplus.
Provided that region1 has crop insurance, then if it is not the case that whenever time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure, then region1 does not achieve high yield.
In case region1 has an irrigation system, region1 implements water conservation.
Should region1 use drought-resistant crops, then if it is not the case that provided time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure, then region1 does not achieve high yield.
Either region1 has emergency funding, or region1 has crop insurance, or region1 uses drought-resistant crops.
Whenever time1 is the growing season, then if region1 has an irrigation system, region1 produces sufficient food.
If region1 uses fertilizer, then region1 has soil testing.
Assuming region1 has soil testing, then should time1 not be the growing season, region1 has crop failure.
If it is not the case that whenever region1 experiences drought, region1 implements water rationing, then region1 has water conflict.
Provided that it is not the case that if region1 experiences drought, then region1 implements water rationing, then region1 does not have water conflict.
Should it not be the case that either region1 has government subsidy or if region1 implements water conservation, then region1 produces sufficient food, then region1 has private funding.

In the event that it is not the case that either region1 has government subsidy or provided region1 implements water conservation, region1 produces sufficient food, then region1 does not have private funding.
If it is not the case that provided time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure, then region1 achieves high yield.

(A1 → G).natural: If region1 has abundant rainfall, then region1 produces sufficient food.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either region1 has abundant rainfall or region1 has an irrigation system.

(A10 ∨ (¬A3 → A4)).natural: Either region1 uses modern techniques, or provided that time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure.

(A11 → A10).natural: Whenever region1 has an agricultural expert, region1 uses modern techniques.

(A11 ∨ A12).natural: Region1 has an agricultural expert or region1 follows best practices.

(A12 → (¬A3 → A4)).natural: If region1 follows best practices, then in case time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure.

(A13 → (A12 → (¬A3 → A4))).natural: Provided that region1 monitors crop health, it follows that if region1 follows best practices, then whenever time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure.

(A14 → A15).natural: In the event that region1 experiences drought, region1 has water surplus.

(A14 → A16).natural: Should region1 experience drought, region1 implements water rationing.

(A14 → ¬A15).natural: If region1 experiences drought, then it is not the case that region1 has water surplus.

(A14 ∨ A3).natural: Either region1 experiences drought or time1 is the growing season.

(A16 → ¬A15).natural: Assuming region1 implements water rationing, region1 does not have water surplus.

(A19 → (¬(¬A3 → A4) → ¬A18)).natural: Provided that region1 has crop insurance, then if it is not the case that whenever time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure, then region1 does not achieve high yield.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: Region1 has crop insurance or region1 uses drought-resistant crops.

(A2 → A7).natural: In case region1 has an irrigation system, region1 implements water conservation.

(A2 → G).natural: If region1 has an irrigation system, then region1 produces sufficient food.

(A20 → (¬(¬A3 → A4) → ¬A18)).natural: Should region1 use drought-resistant crops, then if it is not the case that provided time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure, then region1 does not achieve high yield.

(A21 ∨ (A19 ∨ A20)).natural: Either region1 has emergency funding, or region1 has crop insurance, or region1 uses drought-resistant crops.

(A3 → (A2 → G)).natural: Whenever time1 is the growing season, then if region1 has an irrigation system, region1 produces sufficient food.

(A5 → (¬A3 → A4)).natural: Provided that region1 uses fertilizer, then in the event that time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure.

(A5 → A6).natural: If region1 uses fertilizer, then region1 has soil testing.

(A6 → (¬A3 → A4)).natural: Assuming region1 has soil testing, then should time1 not be the growing season, region1 has crop failure.

(A7 → G).natural: In case region1 implements water conservation, region1 produces sufficient food.

(A8 ∨ (A7 → G)).natural: Either region1 has government subsidy, or if region1 implements water conservation, then region1 produces sufficient food.

(¬(A14 → A16) → A17).natural: If it is not the case that whenever region1 experiences drought, region1 implements water rationing, then region1 has water conflict.

(¬(A14 → A16) → ¬A17).natural: Provided that it is not the case that if region1 experiences drought, then region1 implements water rationing, then region1 does not have water conflict.

(¬(A8 ∨ (A7 → G)) → A9).natural: Should it not be the case that either region1 has government subsidy or if region1 implements water conservation, then region1 produces sufficient food, then region1 has private funding.

(¬(A8 ∨ (A7 → G)) → ¬A9).natural: In the event that it is not the case that either region1 has government subsidy or provided region1 implements water conservation, region1 produces sufficient food, then region1 does not have private funding.

(¬(¬A3 → A4) → A18).natural: If it is not the case that provided time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure, then region1 achieves high yield.

(¬(¬A3 → A4) → ¬A18).natural: Provided that it is not the case that whenever time1 is not the growing season, region1 has crop failure, then region1 does not achieve high yield.

(¬A3 → A4).natural: If time1 is not the growing season, then region1 has crop failure.

¬A10.natural: It is not the case that region1 uses modern techniques.

¬A21.natural: Region1 does not have emergency funding.

¬A4.natural: Region1 does not have crop failure.

¬A8.natural: Region1 does not have government subsidy.
